entry.title: [Extensions c2s] Add extensions controls buttons directly to container
entry.content:
Extension controls used to be a view to have a background color for

the extensions toolbar and requests access button. Since the background

was removed on crrev.com/c/5121173, we can:

1. Add the buttons directly to the extensions container

2. Remove view from extension controls



Having all the buttons in the same level (extensions container) fixed:

- requests access and extensions toolbar button animations

- extensions menu anchoring to wrong position



Next CLs will move the controls functionality to the container, and

remove the class.



Screencast:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/17SqnGsh8tXZglRGG6jUaU9fWLhKy-SeX/view?usp=sharing



Bug: 1511762

entry.title: add ok status to error histogram
entry.content:
* Removed errorCallback when the user is offline when they click

"Create". Setting status to kOk was redundant since that callback

would be called when the CTA is clicked, which already sets status

to kOk.

* Added kOk status to Error histogram and renamed it to Status, since

it isn't just errors.

* Changed the recording of status to be when status is set, rather

than in the observer, since that wouldn't record multiple kOk statuses

in a row, which would be a problem if we want to see percentage of

status changes are errors.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[NewTabPage.WallpaperSearch.Error]=Replaced with NewTabPage.WallpaperSearch.Status



Bug: b/316626953

entry.title: Break out DialogModelButton from DialogModelFields
entry.content:
This type isn't appropriate to host inside a DialogModelSection. It

really belongs with the DialogModel (as ok, cancel, extra buttons).

Instead we rename this to be DialogModel::Button entirely separate from

fields within content.



OnButtonsUpdated() is also added to DialogModelHost instead of going

through DialogModelField updates.

entry.title: [realbox] Fix text truncation in realbox due to remove button.
entry.content:
In the omnibox, the remove icon only takes space when a row is hovered

or focused. In the chrome refresh realbox, it always takes space which

causes extra truncation on narrow browser windows. This CL fixes this

by only making the remove icon take space when a row is hovered or

focused.

entry.title: [CIC] Fix PasswordSettingsSearchTest on automotive bots
entry.content:
Auto sign in is disabled on automotive. So there is no "Auto sign-in"

toggle in the settings view.



The test failed because of it can not find the view with

string R.string.passwords_auto_signin_title, i.e. the "Auto sign-in"

toggle, on automotive devices. The test used that string to test if

the app navigates to correct screen. This CL replaces

passwords_auto_signin_title with another string

password_settings_save_passwords such that this string exists in

both automotive and non-automotive.

entry.title: Fragmentation: Simplify gathering of OOF descendants to lay out.
entry.content:
If we simply allow OOF descendant propagation when cloning the old

fragments (instead of disabling it), we get this list for free. This way

we won't have to look at the old physical fragment and convert

everything from physical to logical.



We now grab the OOF fragmentainer descendants off the builder, so that

they don't get repropagated further up (where they don't belong; we're

peeking inside a nested multicol at this point). We are not interested

in the OOF "candidates", but we similarly need to make sure that they

don't get repropagated, so this list now needs to be manually cleared.



No behavior changes intended.



Change-Id: I5fbef59b0cac2d8cc3e2d7827186b754300581fe

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5134888

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Reviewed-by: Alison Maher

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1239310}

entry.content:

triggers metrics collection by advancing the mock clock to the next

timeout. This will let a followup switch from the timer to a

ScopedResourceQuery with the same timeout.



Also fixes the ordering of methods in page_resource_monitor.cc to match

the header.

entry.title: [CSC] Define CapturedSurfaceController
entry.content:
CapturedSurfaceController encapsulates the state and logic associated

with the Capture Surface Control APIs. It is associated with a given

capture-session through placing it in the relevant DeviceRequest.

It is instantiated the first time it is needed.



When share-this-tab-instead is called, the controller's target is

updated.



This CL is future-proof for dynamic switching of the capture target

across surface-types. (That is, for example, changing between

capturing a tab to capturing a screen and vice versa.)

entry.title: [ImprovedDownloadWarnings] Hook up dangerous warning bypass prompt
entry.content:
This hooks up the new WebUI download warning bypass flow for dangerous

files to the mojo browser interface, adding several new methods to

support the new flow: For "dangerous" downloads, we can now validate

from the new WebUI prompt instead of going through the native UI

DownloadDangerPrompt. This requires a user gesture on the WebContents.

There are also methods added to record stats/safe browsing reports for

events like opening or cancelling the prompt. ("Dangerous" in this

context is in contrast to "Suspicious" warning bypass which is

implemented in the previous CL, crrev.com/c/5075464.)



Internal CL for csd.proto: cl/590626956

entry.title: [base] Add SequencedTaskRunner::RunOrPostTask.
entry.content:
`SequencedTaskRunner::RunOrPostTask` may run its callback synchronously

if no work that is sequenced with the `SequencedTaskRunner` is queued

or running. It can be used to avoid the overhead of posting a task

(OS scheduling, message pump internal work...) to execute a short

callback in sequence with other work.



The first use case will be sending a message on a channel-associated

Mojo interface [1]. We are implementing the minimum functionality to

to support that use case (not supporting Thread Pool or sequence-local

storage) and keeping access to `RunOrPostTask` gated by a PassKey

until all rough edges have been polished.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ipc/ipc_mojo_bootstrap.cc;l=855-859;drc=59ac8227c5dd59754331b3f7f9f85e1a947f1242

entry.title: [webauthn] Fix win credential applicability
entry.content:
Chrome attempts to determine the applicability of the Windows platform

authenticator for allow-list get assertion requests by identifying

descriptors that are valid candidates. Since developers may omit the

"transports" parameter, the logic attempted to match descriptors with an

empty "transports" or one set to exactly ["internal"].



Unfortunately, the renderer translates empty transport lists to an array

containing all transports, so that piece of code has always been broken.

This was made more apparent recently as now the label on the Windows

Hello button changes depending on credential availability.



This CL relaxes the applicability check to credentials that contain

"internal" instead, which addresses the issue.



Fixed: 1509758,1509999

entry.title: [A11y] When unpausing an update, rebuild tree immediately
entry.content:
When tree updates are paused, we mark the document dirty so that it

is rebuilt. This CL changes the code so that we rebuild the

tree immediately when unpausing, rather than leaving the tree

in an incomplete state. This fixes the referenced Clusterfuzz bug where objects were accessed at a time that object properties were expected to

be frozen, but the properties were marked dirty. A unit test is added

to simulate the conditions created by the Clusterfuzz test.



Note: when tree updates are paused, it's because there are too many updates, and we make a guess that just rebuilding the tree from the root

is the better option for performance, even though this could cause the

user to lose their place because all of the newly generated AXObjects

will have new AXIDs. This problem will be helped by stable ids

(CL:4185636).



Bug: 1512428,1507170

Change-Id: I475ad5af5010ca4d273e54c4ac4865a0d89e68bb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5089911

entry.title: [RWS] Remove kStorageAccessAPI feature
entry.content:
This feature has been enabled by default, with the default values for

all of its FeatureParams, since https://crrev.com/c/4874417.



This removal is mostly mechanical, with some exceptions for unit- and

browsertests: many tests actually rely on the ability to prompt

the user for permission, or assume that prompts are disabled; but

this is controlled by the `kPermissionStorageAccessAPI` feature, which

is not appropriately controlled for these tests. I added test fixtures and migrated all of the tests that make such assumptions.



I also preserved the "implicit grants" functionality and tests, even

though Chrome does not use it, because Edge sets the implicit grant

limit to a nonzero value (5, IIRC).

entry.title: Reland "[BreakIterator] Refactor by adding `Context`"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit a8b10f34a154feb602d10097d2aca0b9d48af19c



The MSAN failure[1] was caused by `Context.last_last_ch` not

being initilized. Unlike `current` and `last`, `last_last_ch`

is `CharacterType`, which is either `LChar` or `UChar`.



This reland has the fix for it. See the diff from PS1.



[1] https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/WebKit%20Linux%20MSAN/24235/overview



Original change's description:

> [BreakIterator] Refactor by adding `Context`

>

> This patch refactors `LazyLineBreakIterator`, in particular,

> its hottest function `NextBreakablePosition` by introducing

> the `Context` struct.

>

> The `Context` struct caches 3 characters at the index, and is

> responsible for advancing the current index. This refactoring

> is a preparation for improving the performance of

> `PreviousBreakOpportunity`.

>

> Note, the current index isn't part of the struct, because

> doing so seems to have a negative impact.

>

> This patch has no behavior changes.

>

> Bug: 1512434

> Change-Id: I051eed75c2a666b8ef183154c0a7adebba7d3a85

entry.title: Remove CSS Zoom Adjustment for GetBoundingClientRect
entry.content:
This change modifies the behavior of the call for elements with a CSS

property. Previously, the dimensions of the bounding box returned by

GetBoundingClientRect were adjusted to the effective zoom of an

element, which is the combination of the page zoom and the CSS zoom.

This meant that the dimensions were not affected by either of those

values.



This had the unintended consequence of causing two elements with the

same size before zoom, but with different zoom properties, to have the

same sized bounding box, even though they had different sizes on the

page. This also caused crbug.com/967097



The new behavior adjusts the bounding box to the page's zoom, but not to

the CSS zoom. This means that two elements with the same size before

zoom, but with different zoom properties, will now have different sized

bounding boxes.



Follow up patches will add the same logic to other calls in the file to

ensure consistency between the calls.



Bug: 967097, 1510969, 1511048



Change-Id: I66e8d4ca02f117c6133bb15cea29fc5c50c5d819

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5085708

entry.title: Lacros-Test: Remove outdated comment about WebAppControllerBrowserTest
entry.content:
WebAppControllerBrowserTest is the base test class used by

many web app tests, which include both ash and lacros test.

In ash, it only needs to run with Lacros disabled. If Lacros

is enabled and crosapi is also enabled (the tests runs in

lacros_chrome_browsertests), IsWebAppsCrosapiEnabled() should

be validated.



When I tested with LacrosWebAppsControllerBrowserTest in

lacros_chrome_browsertests, I noticed sometimes the test

(LacrosWebAppsControllerBrowserTest.AppList) failed with

VerifyNoAshBrowserWindowOpenRightNow() in InProcessBrowserTest::PostRunTestOnMainThread(), which means

there are some active ash browser UI not being closed after test

tears down ( probably race between uninstalling testing app and

removing it from ash shelf and closing the window).

So I added some clean up in the test tear down to close

all ash browser UIs.

entry.title: [LCPP] Exclude loading=lazy sizes=auto
entry.content:
LCPPLazyLoadImagePreload is a feature to preload lazy loaded images

very early in the pipeline to optimize page load performance. Lazy load

auto size images () differ from

regular lazy loaded images because they _must_ wait for layout before

selecting the src (https://chromestatus.com/feature/5191555708616704).

This patch excludes lazy load auto size images from the LCPP lazy load

preload experiment. This should not affect the experiment's impact as

sizes=auto images are currently very rare.

entry.title: [IdleTimeout] Adding pref for idle timeout set as user policy on iOS
entry.content:
IdleTimeoutActions may require an action to be applied differently

if the policy is set as a user policy. Currently, if a data clearing

action is set, it clears the data for TimePeriod::ALL_TIME.

Since there is only one profile on iOS, data will be cleared for

the sign-in session only if the policy is set as a user policy.



This CL introduces a pref that will be used to determine whether

data should be cleared from the time of sign in or for the whole

time. The action implementation update will be implemented in a

separate CL.



Bug: b/301676922

Change-Id: I0b9fac01d875c792aea77bdccfa9b7ee26bc321d

entry.title: Adding a method to remove data between start and end time
entry.content:
There is currently no way to delete data between two timestamps on iOS.

All methods that remove data right now are either to delete all data or to delete data within the timeframe selected from the settings UI which maps to a `TimePeriod` enum.



This CL adds a method to the `BrowsingDataRemover` to delete data

between two timestamps. This method will be used for enterprise policies

that require to delete data only for a given timeframe. This will

mainly be used for policies that clear data from the time the user

signed in only.



An example of a policy that will use this in a follow-up CL is

IdleTimeoutActions which might clear data only for the time the user

was signed in if it was set as a user policy. Please see IdleTimeoutActions.yaml for more details about the policy.



Bug: b/301676922

entry.title: Avoid dangling pointers in ProxyDelegate/ProxyResolutionService impls
entry.content:
Removes DanglingUntriaged annotations in

ConfiguredProxyResolutionService and NetworkServiceProxyDelegate.

These classes store pointers to each other but are both owned by a

UrlRequestContext, so when the UrlRequestContext is destroyed we

clear the pointer of the object that will be destroyed first (the

ProxyResolutionService).



Also, this moves the logic that stores the pointers to each other

into the UrlRequestContextBuilder so that it's closer to where

the "undo" logic is.



Bug: 1291138

entry.title: SyncSchedulerImpl: Use WallClockTimer for polling (behind Feature)
entry.content:
As opposed to the regular OneShotTimer, WallClockTimer keeps counting

while the device is suspended, which is exactly what's desired for poll

requests.

Since this has the potential to influence Sync traffic, the new logic

is behind a (disabled-by-default) Feature.

returning account. This is correct in the single IDP case but not in the

multiple IDP case.

entry.title: [Extensions c2s] Add ToolbarChipButton with flat edges
entry.content:
ToolbarButton has two formats: default and highlight (label with

border). This CL introduces a new formatting that allows the button

to have a flat edge. To not interfere with the existing toolbar

buttons formatting, it's implemented as ToolbarChipButton.



Toolbar chip button is used in the extensions toolbar to display

the extensions request access button (right flat edge) and the

extensions toolbar button (left flat edge only when request access

button is visible). This will allow us to remove the extensions

controls view and add the toolbar buttons directly to the extensions

container.



Screenshot:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dacX_zUOjTspVojxzzB_ArpAOcw9jPFp/view?usp=sharing

Screencast: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1w0oQgpg4Npk_blJqwtK_W1GRD8KGaIvc/view?usp=sharing

entry.title: Delineate 'background-attachment: fixed' in BackgroundImageGeometry
entry.content:
Explicitly handle it within BackgroundImageGeometry::Calculate() now

that said function is much smaller (and thus hopefully easier to follow)

and more manageable. This allows seeing both the pre- and post-

adjustments to the computed geometry in the same function. Fold

UseFixedAttachment() and split some functions on

BoxBackgroundPaintContext in support of this.
